page.title: 02Farming in the Horton Area
page.content: Horton is a mainly farming community, the area is prime dairy land due to it's flat rolling fields of lush green grass.Being in the West Country it enjoys warm,damp weather which encourages growth. On the farms some cereal crops are grown such as wheat and barley.Hay is also grown for animals to feed on, vegetables can also be bought at the farms and considering there are no shops in Horton to buy groceries this is a good ideal. The milking starts at around six am and then sometime in the day the CO-OP Dairy Company comes to collect the milk.In Horton there is an agricultural engineering company who sell farm machinery.Some farmland nowadays is used for other things such as camping.
